answers.answer: Hi there!Her symptoms could be related to neuro-muscular issues, vascular insufficiency, micronutrient deficiency such as Ca, vit B12, electrolyte imbalance, hormonal/ endocrinal abnormalities etc. Without an evaluation it would be difficult to determine a particular cause. It would be best to get this evaluated by a primary care physician to rule out the above mentioned possibilities. After a cause(s) is diagnosed, it can be managed accordingly.Hope this helps.Take care!

question: My friend who is 76 years old gets SEVERE cramping in her hands after eating.  She has tried calcium supplements and additional fluids for possible dehydration.  Nothing has helped.  Also, she has been checked for diabetes and does not have that.  I told her I would try to find information on this since she does not have internet access.  Do you have any other possible explanations for her?
title: cramping in hands after eating
